content.description:
This route climbs the slab just to the right of the chimney. The first and only bolt isn't in great shape, and won't protect the leader from a ground fall for most of the route. The small quartz edges make this moderate slab quite enjoyable. 

  It makes the most sense to either climb the route as a highball, or toprope.
content.protection: One old bolt near the start. This bolt has been hammered flat strangely. Maybe an attempt at a chop? This climb shares  the anchor with Titanic. Be sure to use some cord or webbing to keep your rope from dragging on the edge.
content.location: Locate a manky bolt a few feet to the right of the chimney.

content.description:
Great climb up the finger cracks of the Nugget Boulder. Accepts small- medium protection quite easily.  

  This route is probably the best way to access the top of the Nugget Boulder. Once on top of the Nugget, string a toprope on Banana Show (5.11c TR only).
content.protection: Small- medium cams to 1-inch, stoppers. Nice SHINY two bolt anchor on top, extend the anchor over the edge to save your rope.
content.location: Begin in the finger crack on the Nugget's west face. A "walk-off"is possible (if climbing the Nugget as a highball boulder) but I would rather rappel the route given the mossy jump required to get down.

content.description: Mary Poppins climbs the Nugget's prominent chimney. Start inside, clip a bolt, then work your way onto the face near the second bolt. Slightly runout, but very secure for a 5.7 chimney.
content.protection: Two bolts with wire hangers in place (you still need at least a carabiner or quickdraw to clip). On top is a(single/double?) bolt anchor. (single button head)
content.location: Left side of the Nugget, the gaping chimney.

content.description:
Toprope only. Climb this! A balancy slab leads to a shallow corner. At the top of the corner, start moving toward the arete to maintain the suggested rating. My favorite route at the Nugget. 

  Does anyone know who the FA is?
content.protection: Toprope only. This route has a dedicated anchor.  Too bad, it would be a fun sport lead.
content.location: On the south face of the Nugget Boulder, look for the beautiful orange face. To descend, rappel one of the routes or jump across the gap to the east.

content.description: This route starts with a boulder problem right off the bat, then traverses left in the wider of the two cracks. After a few feet, the route merges with Titanic.
content.protection: Gear to two inches. Shares anchors with Titanic (recently replaced two bolt anchor).
content.location:
Start at the southwest corner of the Nugget, trying to stay out of the deep puddle. There are a few rocks to stand on here. 

  Rap the route, unless you are keen on the jump portion of the "walk-off".

content.description:
The Nugget Boulder is a 30 foot tall chunk of granite that has five good routes on it. The rock quality is excellent here.  

  The rock gets afternoon sun, as most of the routes are west facing. This is a great place to warm up, or a good place to take budding climbers.  

  There are (two,three?) bolted anchors on top, each equipped with rap rings. A "walk-off" is possible, although the jump may convince most parties to rappel.
